greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n, k) is the number of forests on n labeled nodes with k edges. T(n, k) for n >= 1 and 0 <= k <= n-1.
comment: The rows of the triangle give the coefficients of the Ehrhart polynomials of integral Coxeter permutahedra of type A. These polynomials count lattice points in a dilated lattice polytope. For a definition see Ardila et al. (p. 1158), the generating functions of these polynomials for the classical root systems are given in theorem 5.2 (p. 1163). - _Peter Luschny_, May 01 2021
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
Federico Ardila, Matthias Beck, and Jodi McWhirter, The arithmetic of Coxeter permutahedra, Rev. Acad. Colomb. Cienc. Ex. Fis. Nat. 44(173):1152-1166, 2020.
John Riordan and N. J. A. Sloane, Correspondence, 1974
formula: Recurrence equation for row polynomials R(n,t): R(n,t) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} (k+1)^(k-1)*binomial(n-1,k)*t^k*R(n-k-1,t) with R(0,t) = R(1,t) = 1.
The production matrix for the row polynomials of the triangle is obtained from A088956 and starts:
E.g.f.: exp( Sum_{n >= 1} n^(n-2)*t^(n-1)*x^n/n! ). - _Peter Bala_, Nov 08 2015
T(n, k) = [x^k] n! [t^n] exp(-W(-t*x)/t - W(-t*x)^2/(2*t)), where W denotes the Lambert function. - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 30 2021
maple: T:= proc(n) option remember; if n=0 then 0 else T(n-1) +n^(n-1) *x^n/n! fi end: TT:= proc(n) option remember; expand(T(n) -T(n)^2/2) end: f:= proc(k) option remember; if k=0 then 1 else unapply(f(k-1)(x) +x^k/k!, x) fi end: A:= proc(n,k) option remember; series(f(k)(TT(n)), x,n+1) end: aa:= (n,k)-> coeff(A(n,k), x,n) *n!: a:= (n,k)-> aa(n,n-k) -aa(n,n-k-1): seq(seq(a(n,k), k=0..n-1), n=1..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 02 2008
ser := series(EhrA, x, 12): cx := n -> n!*coeff(ser, x, n):
T := n -> seq(coeff(cx(n), t, k), k=0..n-1):
mathematica: t[0, 0] = 1; t[n_ /; n >= 1, k_] /; (0 <= k <= n-1) := t[n, k] = Sum[(i+1)^(i-1)*Binomial[n-1, i]*t[n-i-1, k-i], {i, 0, k}]; t[_, _] = 0; Table[t[n, k], {n, 1, 10}, {k, 0, n-1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 14 2014, after _Peter Bala_ *)
gf := E^(-(ProductLog[-(t x)] (2 + ProductLog[-(t x)]))/(2 t));
ser := Series[gf, {x, 0, 12}]; cx[n_] := n! Coefficient[ser, x, n];
xref: Row sums give A001858. Rightmost diagonal gives A000272. Cf. A136605.
Rows reflected give A105599. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 28 2011
For Ehrhart polynomials of integral Coxeter permutahedra of classical type cf. this sequence (type A), A343805 (type B), A343806 (type C), A343807 (type D).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 09 2008
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 02 2008
